intro: Stylidium periscelianthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred petals and a distinctive, elongated labellum. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial herb with a short, stocky stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, with a prominent central column that houses the reproductive structures. Stylidium periscelianthum is often found in shaded, moist environments and is adapted to thrive in the understorey of dense forests.
